issues.description: The problem statement (UML and task 1.2) requires the constructor to initialize attributes in the order shown in the UML: lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors. The reference solution's constructor signature uses a different parameter order (String lectureName, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents), which contradicts the specified order. This mismatch can confuse students (the task explicitly asks to follow the UML order) and may cause test/usage errors if callers or autograding expect the UML order.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the constructor in the solution repository to use the attribute parameter order specified in the UML and task: (String lectureName, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors). Ensure the constructor assigns each parameter to the corresponding field in that same order. Alternatively, if the intended constructor order is different, update the problem statement and task text (and UML) to explicitly reflect the adopted parameter order so students are not misled.
